text:
Question 147) A non -governmental organization released a data survey conducted in some Brazilian cities on basic sanitation. The results indicate that only 36% of the sewage generated in these cities is treated, which shows that 8 billion liters of sewage without any treatment are launched every day in the waters.
A campaign to improve basic sanitation in these cities has the goal of reducing the amount of sewage released in the waters daily, without treatment, to 4 billion liters in the coming months.
If the generated sewage volume remains the same and the goal of this campaign is to materialize, the sewage percentage treated will be
A) 72%
B) 68%
C) 64%
D) 54%
E) 18%
